title: Marco Sturm’s faith in Marat Khusnutdinov gets rewarded with Bruins OT winner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored the overtime winner in the Bruins' 4-3 victory against the Buffalo Sabres on Thursday.
Coach Marco Sturm elevated Khusnutdinov to the top line, citing his hard work and potential as reasons for the promotion.
Despite Elias Lindholm's injury, Khusnutdinov excelled at center, contributing to the team with 15:20 of ice time and strong faceoff performance.

title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye has led the New England Patriots to a 6-2 start with significant contributions despite limited surrounding talent.
Dan Orlovsky argues that Maye, more than Jonathan Taylor, deserves NFL MVP recognition for his pivotal role in the Patriots' success.
Maye has thrown for 2,026 yards, 15 passing touchdowns, and rushed for 251 yards with two touchdowns this season.

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm in Brookline is starting a free farmers market at Loring Greenough House in Jamaica Plain.
The market, open on November's first three Thursdays, offers free produce and bread amidst the SNAP shutdown threat.
Governor Maura Healey announced a new SNAP resource hub and increased aid to food banks in response to the shutdown.

title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Watertown police investigate a theft of approximately $9,000 in donations from St. Patrick’s Church on Main Street.
The alleged theft occurred sometime after 5:30 p.m. on October 27 and was reported on October 28.
Police have not released details about suspects; public urged to contact Detective Joe Kelland with information.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm suffered a lower-body injury after a collision with Buffalo's Jordan Greenway during Thursday's game.
Lindholm did not return after the second period, and Bruins coach Marco Sturm had no immediate update on his condition.
Zacha and Khusnutdinov are potential replacements for Lindholm as top-line center; Khusnutdinov scored the OT winner on Thursday.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mookie Betts is struggling in the World Series, batting .130 with no extra-base hits or RBIs.
David Ortiz advised Betts to focus on enjoying the game and forget the pressure of past performances.
Dodgers' key hitters, including Betts, Ohtani, and Freeman, went 1-for-15 in Game 5 against the Blue Jays.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Irish firefighter Terence Crosbie sentenced to 7-9 years for raping a woman at a Boston hotel in March 2024.
Crosbie was convicted at a retrial after initial mistrial; key evidence included DNA and video footage.
Crosbie will appeal the verdict, citing his first-time offender status and over 70 positive character letters.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Erickson Barbosa, 32, of Brockton, sentenced to seven years for raping a 14-year-old girl in 2020.
Barbosa fled to Florida in 2024 but was captured and extradited to Massachusetts by U.S. Marshals.
Barbosa, a Cape Verdean citizen, may face deportation after his prison term, according to prosecutors.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones signed a three-year extension with the New England Patriots this October.
Jones named AFC Defensive Player of the Month after crucial plays, including a game-changing interception.
He ranks third in the NFL for punt return yards, showcasing significant special teams contributions.

title: Dartmouth man pleads guilty to 2024 murder of New Bedford woman
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tyler Baglini pleaded guilty to the 2024 murder of Kerri Fidalgo in Fall River Superior Court.
He received a life sentence with the possibility of parole after 25 years for the murder.
Court documents reveal Baglini arrived at the hospital with a knife after Fidalgo's stabbing.
